com.esri.mo2.data.qb
Class QueryEnvironment

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.data.qb.QueryEnvironment
public class QueryEnvironment
extends Object

This class provides the following utility methods.

parse: constructs an expression tree for a given query where clause
compile: creates a WhereClauseExaminer for use with a FeatureClass

See Also:
QTreeNode, QSyntaxException, FeatureClass

compile

public static WhereClauseExaminer compile(QTreeNode root,
                                          Fields fields)
                                   throws QCompileException
compile an expression tree for use with a particular collection of Fields. Note, if you specify a expression tree, then you'll get a "dummy examiner" which always returns true in its test() method

Parameters:
root - the expression tree
fields - the Fields
Returns:
a WhereClauseExaminer
Throws:
QCompileException - if any semantic error detected within the expression tree

Parameters:
value - is value for test
Returns:
true if the value contains

preparse

public static String preparse(String whereClause)
                       throws ParseException
preparse the given where clause and replace all supported occurences of macros - text contained within enclosing curly braces that consist of the form "{name 'value'}" where name is the macro name and value is the macro value.

This method will call the other prepare() method using an instance of the type BasePreParser. You do not normally need to call this method if you are simply planning to call parse() as preparse() is automatically called within parse().

Parameters:
whereClause - the where clause string.
Returns:
parse string.
Throws:
ParseException - if the PreParser signals it
See Also:
BasePreParser

preparse

public static String preparse(String whereClause,
                              PreParser parser)
                       throws ParseException
preparse the given where clause and replace all supported occurences of text contained within enclosing curly braces. The specified PreParser will be used to subtitute occurences of macros detected within the whereClause.

ParseException
See Also:
preparse(String)

parse

public static QTreeNode parse(String whereClause)
                       throws QSyntaxException
Constructs an expression tree for the given where clause. The returned expression tree will be rooted with node named "Expression Tree". Before parsing the where clause, the pre-parser is called to process all Strings of the form "{....}".

Note, if you specify a whereClause, then you'll get a expression tree result, which may be useful when using the compile() method.

Parameters:
whereClause - The WHERE clause to be parsed
QSyntaxException
See Also:
compile(com.esri.mo2.data.qb.QTreeNode, com.esri.mo2.data.feat.Fields), preparse(java.lang.String)

encodeString

public static String encodeString(String value)
Encode a String value from given String object that is suitable for an expression. All single-quote marks are replaced with two single-quote characters, and surrounding quotes are added. For example, value=abc is returned as 'abc', while value=ab'cde is returned as 'ab''cde'

Parameters:
value - to be encoded
Returns:
the encoded result

constructSimpleExpression

public static String constructSimpleExpression(String fieldName,
                                               String operator,
                                               Object value)
Construct an expression for given field name, operator and Object value. Takes care of quotes for String values.

Parameters:
fieldName - the field name
operator - the operator
value - the value to be encoded
Returns:
the expression string

parseDate

public static Date parseDate(String data)
                      throws ParseException
Attempt to parse a TimeStamp-format date string using the following five DateFormats:
  • "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"
  • "yyyy-MM-dd"
  • "yyyy-MM-dd HH"
  • "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm"
  • "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS"
Each date format is used in turn until a successful parse occurs

Returns:
the parsed Date
Throws:
ParseException - if the data cannot be parsed by any of the date formats

quoteDate

public static String quoteDate(Date date)
Add a single quote to the given date

Parameters:
date - the Date to be quoted
Returns:
a quoted Date string

encodeDate

public static String encodeDate(Date value)
Encode a Date value, into TimeStamp format, from the given Date object. The date is formatted using the ODBC TimeStamp format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"

Parameters:
value - to be encoded
Returns:
the encoded result

stripQuotes

public static String stripQuotes(String value)
Remove optional surrounding single-quote marks

Parameters:
value - the input string
Returns:
a string with single-quoted marks removed
